definition: called/to call sth (by a name)/to name
to call oneself/to claim to be/to profess/to claim a title
can be rated as/can be said to be
it is said/allegedly/according to reports/or so they say
to be known as/to be nicknamed/to be purportedly/to claim (often exaggeratedly or falsely)

sentences.english: The RCMP said its investigation is continuing.
sentences.chinese: 皇家騎警稱調查正在繼續。

sentences.english: Experts said the study should prompt countries to reconsider how they classify drugs.
sentences.chinese: 專家稱，這項研究應該促使各國重新考慮藥品的分類。

sentences.english: I will praise God's name in song and glorify him with thanksgiving.
sentences.chinese: 我要以詩歌讚美神的名，以感謝稱他爲大。
老百姓都稱其爲“骨架電話機”。

sentences.english: Duggan, a father of four, died of a single gunshot wound to the chest, an inquest at north London Coroner's Court heard on Tuesday.
sentences.chinese: 驗屍報告稱，這位四歲小孩的父親被槍擊中胸腔致死。

sentences.english: He even calls her by a cute nickname, "Snips."
sentences.chinese: 他甚至用一個可愛的暱稱，“小鬼頭”來叫她。

sentences.english: Nokia said the N8 would be widely available in coming weeks."The
sentences.chinese: 諾基亞稱，N8將在未來幾周內得到廣泛應用。

sentences.english: It was very nice that the drivers called us "little Lei Feng"
sentences.chinese: 最讓人高興的是，司機叔叔稱我們是小雷鋒。

sentences.english: European commissioner Chris Patten caught the mood when he suggested yesterday that Israel had dealt with a fire by pouring gasoline on the flames.
sentences.chinese: 歐盟外委會專員彭定康稱，以色列這是往火上澆油。

sentences.english: Geomantic avoid learning appropriate piece in emphasize glancing particularly for big fierce, say to glance evil spirit.
sentences.chinese: 風水學宜忌篇中非凡強調反光爲大凶，稱反光煞。

sentences.english: Forms in which the stripes are obscure or lacking are called grass snakes.
sentences.chinese: 條紋不明顯或無條紋的種類通常稱草蛇。

sentences.english: The institute called the policy “a resounding success.
sentences.chinese: 卡託研究所稱這個政策是“一場徹底的勝利。”

sentences.english: The script refers to this single-man walker as a modified scout walker.
sentences.chinese: 劇本稱這種單人步行機爲改造過的探察步行機。

sentences.english: They say part of their income comes from the registration fee.
sentences.chinese: 他們稱他們部分收入來源於掛號費。

sentences.english: Australian reports said the other three men were Chinese passport-holders.
sentences.chinese: 澳大利亞稱其他三名男子持中國護照。

definition: category/genus (taxonomy)/family members/dependents/to belong to/subordinate to/affiliated with/be born in the year of (one of the 12 animals)/to be/to prove to be/to constitute
to join together/to fix one's attention on/to concentrate on
one's conduct/deed/activity/accomplishment/achievement/to act as/as (in the capacity of)/qua/to view as/to look upon (sth as)/to take sth to be
called/to call sth (by a name)/to name
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
(conjunction used to express contrast with a previous clause) but/then/standard/norm/principle/to imitate/to follow/classifier for written items
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
to think (i.e. to take it to be true that ...) (Usually there is an implication that the notion is mistaken – except when expressing one's own current opinion.)
